intro: Trichantha aliena, commonly known as the alien thornweed, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, clustered leaves. Its flowers are unisexual, with separate male and female flowers on the same plant. Trichantha aliena is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in humid, tropical environments.
